definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: With the countless torches lit, with the silent sea of faces and the unbarred heads.
sentences.chinese: 無數火炬燃起，無數臉孔和致哀者彙集的沉默海洋。

sentences.english: Forged in a fire lit long ago, stand next to me, you'll never stand i moreovertself.
sentences.chinese: 歷煉之火早已燃起，與我比肩，你將永不寂寞。

sentences.english: Better to light one candle than to curse the dark-ness.
sentences.chinese: 與其詛咒黑暗，毋如燃起蠟燭。

sentences.english: When he left, I saw his face with a crimson.
sentences.chinese: 他離開時，我看到他的臉上燃起一片緋紅。

sentences.english: The Libya operation has reinvigorated African fears about American power.
sentences.chinese: 利比亞行動重新燃起了非洲對美國力量的恐懼感。

sentences.english: As evening falls, each family begins to put on their lights.
sentences.chinese: 初更時候，家家戶戶開始燃起燈火。

sentences.english: The night's silence , like a deep lamp, is burning with the light of its milky way.
sentences.chinese: 夜的靜謐，如一盞深沉的燈，銀河便是它燃起的燈光。

sentences.english: They turned round, and every man there saw his own cottage burning.
sentences.chinese: 大家轉頭一看，每個人都看到自己家的房子燃起大火。

sentences.english: What can we do to re-ignite our passion?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣才能使我們的熱情重新燃起呢？

sentences.english: Families lit incense and wept in front of piles of rubble.
sentences.chinese: 倖存的人家燃起薰香，在一片廢墟中悲泣。

sentences.english: Make sure use the saw with continuous watering to prevent building a fire through scraping.
sentences.chinese: 使用盤鋸肯定不要斷水，防止摩擦生熱陰燃起火。

sentences.english: The battle for supremacy in the mobile industry has only just begun.
sentences.chinese: 移動產業，誰主沉浮，戰火纔剛剛燃起。

sentences.english: He tried to rekindle her attention.
sentences.chinese: 他想再去燃起她的情火。

sentences.english: Zuo Feiyo and Ku Bai gathered some dry branches and made a fire below the tower .
sentences.chinese: 左非右與褲白撿了一些枯枝，在塔下燃起一個火堆。
我們燃起了一堆堆篝火。

sentences.english: I also went out just kindled the compassion, the head also does not answer to go.
sentences.chinese: 我也熄滅了剛剛燃起的一絲憐憫，頭也不回地走了。

definition: to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
a single spark (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
